lines.text: I told the nice gen'lman I'd give meself up now, mother.
You always was a good boy, Slasher.
[last lines]
Er, tell me, Holmes - at what school did you learn to be a detective?
Elementary, my dear Watkins, elementary.
You may be big, but I'm small.
I may be down, but the jig is up.
Watkins, in a moment there'll be a knock at the door heralding the start of the case of the Shropshire Slasher. Answer it. My pants are caught in a nail.
Name? Speak up, old boy.
Shropshire Slasher.
Occupation?
Shropshire Slasher.
[as Watkins opens the door, the telegram boy falls]
Don't touch that body! A clear case of Karrer poisoning of one of Her Majesty's cold cream guards.

[Gets up]
Telegram. You'd best have that step fixed, Gov'nor!
Just for that, you receive no gratuity.
Lady Asthabula, the last time we met was at Ascot, was it not? Ascot not.
[as he kisses her hand, he takes her finger prints]
Oh, you're still a fine figure of a woman.
[Examines fingerprints]
Egad! These look like a woman's fingerprints. Could it be possible that the Shropshire Slasher is really a...
Oh, Alfie, this cove's annoying me.

[At the dart board]
Oh, is he, now?
Oho! Alfie, is it? Where was you on the night of the...
[Is pelted with darts]
Well, he has eliminated him as a suspect.
All right, Watkins. Enough of your bumbling.
B-Bumbling upsets Holmes no end.
Care to buy some pretty pretties for your doxie, Gov'nor?
That does it! I'm gonna haul you in. Hawking dandelions without a license.
Mother!
Mother? Mother? Really?
[Shropshire Slasher beats up Holmes]
N-now look, old boy. H-How's about returning to prison? There's a good chap.
Yes, sir. I want to do what's right, I do.
